dcterms:creator: P. Schmidt
A. Reiss
R. Duerichen
C. Marberger
K. Van Laerhoven
dcterms:description: The WESAD dataset includes data from a study to elicit three different affective states (neutral, stress, amusement) to 15 subjects, where physiological signals were recorded using a wristband. The dataset serves as a benchmark for testing emotion recognition methods.
dcterms:title: WESAD (Wearable Stress and Affect Detection)

dcterms:creator: S. Koelstra
C. Muhl
M. Soleymani
J.-S. Lee
A. Yazdani
T. Ebrahimi
T. Pun
A. Nijholt
I. Patras
dcterms:description: The SAM dataset is used for subjective emotional assessments, where participants evaluate their valence and arousal levels. It is utilized in conjunction with physiological signals to enhance emotion recognition.
dcterms:title: SAM (Self-Assessment Manikin)
